questions.question: She is younger than ……………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are preferred after as and than. Subject pronouns are unusual unless they are accompanied by verbs.

questions.question: She works hard to support ……………………… family.
I never realized that …………………….. was making a mistake.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the subject of a verb should be in its subject form.

questions.question: She asked ……………………… what …………………… wanted.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the verb should be in its object form. Here him is the object of the verb asked and he is the subject of the verb wanted.

questions.question: The young boy is eager to please ………………………. employer.
What she said made no sense to ……………………..
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: They took ………………………… to the doctor.
questions.description: Here him is the object of the verb took.

questions.question: I have known ……………………….. for a long time.
questions.description: They is a subject pronoun and them is an object pronoun. A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in its object form.

questions.question: This is my bag. Which one is ………………………….?
questions.description: Yours is the possessive form of you.

questions.question: Whose bag is this? It is …………………………
questions.description: Her is an object pronoun hers is its possessive form.

questions.question: He made …………………….. wait for hours.
questions.description: Me is the object form of the pronoun I.
